truth: -  "Acoustics is the branch of physics that deals with the study of all mechanical waves in gases, liquids, and solids including topics such as vibration, sound, ultrasound and infrasound."
fiction: -  "Acoustics is the branch of physics that deals with the study of all mechanical waves in vacuums, including topics such as vibration, sound, ultrasound and infrasound."

truth: -  "Sound waves are longitudinal waves that require a medium to travel."
fiction: -  "Sound waves are transverse waves that can travel in a vacuum."

truth: -  "The speed of sound in air at sea level at a temperature of 20 degrees Celsius is approximately 343 meters per second."
fiction: -  "The speed of sound in air at sea level at a temperature of 20 degrees Celsius is approximately 3 meters per second."

truth: -  "Ultrasound is sound waves with frequencies higher than the upper audible limit of human hearing."
fiction: -  "Ultrasound is sound waves with frequencies lower than the lower audible limit of human hearing."

truth: -  "The human ear can typically hear frequencies between 20 Hz and 20,000 Hz."
fiction: -  "The human ear can typically hear frequencies between 20 Hz and 20 Hz."

truth: -  "Infrasound refers to extreme bass waves or vibrations with a frequency below the audibility range of the human ear."
fiction: -  "Infrasound refers to extreme treble waves or vibrations with a frequency above the audibility range of the human ear."

truth: -  "Echo is a reflection of sound that arrives at the listener so delayed that it may be perceived as a distinct sound."
fiction: -  "Echo is a reflection of sound that arrives at the listener so quickly that it may be perceived as a distinct sound."

truth: -  "The Doppler effect is the change in frequency or wavelength of a wave in relation to an observer who is moving relative to the wave source."
fiction: -  "The Doppler effect is the change in color or brightness of a wave in relation to an observer who is moving relative to the wave source."

truth: -  "The pitch of a sound is determined by the frequency of the sound wave."
fiction: -  "The pitch of a sound is determined by the color of the sound wave."

truth: -  "Noise-cancelling headphones use active noise control to reduce unwanted ambient sounds."
fiction: -  "Noise-cancelling headphones use passive noise control to amplify unwanted ambient sounds."

truth: -  "The decibel (dB) is a unit used to measure the intensity of a sound."
fiction: -  "The decibel (dB) is a unit used to measure the color of a sound."

truth: -  "A sound wave's amplitude determines its loudness or volume."
fiction: -  "A sound wave's amplitude determines its speed."

truth: -  "Resonance occurs when an object vibrates at its natural frequency, amplifying the sound produced."
fiction: -  "Resonance occurs when an object vibrates at a random frequency, dampening the sound produced."

truth: -  "The phenomenon of beats is the result of the superposition of two sounds of slightly different frequencies."
fiction: -  "The phenomenon of beats is the result of the superposition of two sounds of exactly the same frequencies."

truth: -  "Reverberation is the persistence of sound in a particular space after the original sound is removed."
fiction: -  "Reverberation is the disappearance of sound in a particular space before the original sound is removed."
